CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 18, 1958, pg. 1 reads: " Saluting the Flag - Walter C. Rainey (front foreground) was selected by Allegheny County Republican Chairman Edward L. Flaherty to lead an audience of 3,000 in reciting "allegiance to the flag" last Friday afternoon at a rally in Syria Mosque, when Vice President Richard M. Nixon was principal speaker. Mr. Rainey is the Republican nominee for the State Legislature in Fifth District (12th and 13th wards).  On the extreme right is Commissioner John M. Walker, candidate for Lieutenant Governor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of men and women reciting the Pledge of Allegiance including from center, Walter C. Rainey, possibly Arthur T. McGonigle, unknown man, John M. Walker, and Hugh Scott, gathered on stage in Syria Mosque for 1958 Republican campaign
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Stages (Platforms)--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Microphone--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Advertising, Political--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Political candidates--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Political campaigns--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Politicians--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Rainey, Walter C.Syria Mosque (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Walker, John M.

Mr. Rainey is the Republican nominee for the State Legislature in Fifth District (12th and 13th wards).  On the extreme right is Commissioner John M. Walker, candidate for Lieutenant Governor. - Harris Photo.
